text: A cable ferry (known as chain ferry, swing ferry, floating bridge, or punt) is a ferry that is guided (and in some cases propelled) across a river by cables connected to both shores. Early cable ferries used either rope or steel chains, with the latter resulting in the name "chain ferry". Both of these were replaced by wire cable in the 19th century. ==List of cable ferry routes== Current cable ferry routes include: ===Albania=== *Butrint Ferry, across the Vivari Channel near
